Description: Body and handle root sherd of Chian pottery, possibly patterned chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; two added red bands lined in white on wall; exterior: black around handle; two bands on lower wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to pottery analysis by P. Dupont (personal communication, 30-31 May 1978) at the Centre de recherches archéologiques, laboratoire de céramologie, Lyon, the clay from this sherd originated in Chios. The accession number used in the clay analysis, 'NAU 39', is written in ink on the break. The decoration on the lower body, though very worn, is consistent with the patterned chalices. The interior decoration is minimal suggesting that it is early.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-79, 82-83, fig. 1) (NAU 39)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0349) (phase 2)
